title: IRTRANS Server Function Module
description:
IRTRANS_SERVER can be used as both a receiver and a transmitter of IR￾TRANS commands. Is UDP_TCP = TRUE is a passive TCP connection, other￾wise set up a passive UDP connection. The type of operation must also be

confgured with IRTRANS device. Once a data connection is available and

sending commands is allowed, S_ENABLE = TRUE. In UDP mode, after the

initial data received from IRTRANS, data can be sent, since in the passive

mode, the UDP-IP parameter is initially not known. The receiving mode is

indicated with R_ENABLE. If data are received they are available in R_BUF

for further processing for other modules. Send data has to be entered by

the modules in the S_BUF, so they are then sent automatically from IR-

name: IRTRANS_SERVER

input.name: UDP_TCP
input.description: Selects the communication mode; FALSE for UDP and TRUE for TCP.

input.name: IP_C
input.description: Data structure for parameterization of the IP control settings.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The actual data to be transmitted.

fields.name: length
fields.description: Length of the data to be sent.

output.name: S_ENABLE
output.description: Indicates whether IRTRANS data can be sent.

output.name: R_ENABLE
output.description: Indicates whether IRTRANS data reception is enabled.

output.name: ERROR
output.description: Error code indicating issues with the IP control settings.
